wikipedia_page.main:
Richard O'Shaughnessy  (1842 – 17 August 1918) was an Irish Home Rule League politician.
He was elected Home Rule MP for Limerick City in 1874 and held the seat until he was appointed a registrar of petty sessions clerks in 1883.After leaving office, he was also Commissioner for Public Works in Ireland from 1891 to 1903, and was considered for the post of Under-Secretary for Ireland twice.He became a Member of the Royal Victorian Order in 1900 and a Companion of the Order of the Bath in 1903.
